KnowledgeBase.Title: substringGE
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: compare string equal boolean case-insensitive substring greater

Function.Description: The substringGE function performs a case-sensitive comparison between two substrings and determines if the first substring is greater than or equal to the second substring. A Boolean value is returned.

Brief.Overview: The substringGE function performs a case-sensitive comparison between the two substrings {string1 start1 end1} and {string2 start2 end2}. If the first substring is greater than or equal to the second substring true is returned; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: Use the substringGE function to compare if the first substring is greater than or equal to the second substring considering the case the of the Strings (case-sensitive).

Syntax.Expression:
(substringGE string1 start1 end1 string2 start2 end2)

(substringGE text1 start1 end1 text2 start2 end2)

Argument.Name: string1
Argument.Note: The first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: start1
Argument.Note: The beginning position of the first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: end1
Argument.Note: The ending position of the first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: string2
Argument.Note: The second String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: start2
Argument.Note: The beginning position of the second String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: end2
Argument.Note: The ending position of the second String or Text to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first substring is greater than or equal to the second substring, and false if second substring is lesser than the first substring.
